## [Course Goals]{.light-green}

![NCEAS logo](images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

- Surface and test new synthesis ideas for feasibility
- Prepare more graduate students to be effective participants in/leaders of the synthesis project
- Connect LTER graduate students across sites
- Develop intergenerational linkages around synthesis research

## [Course Structure]{.light-green}

![NCEAS logo](images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

- Participants: ~27 (approx. 1 graduate students from each LTER site)
- Time frame: Biweekly meetings (1 session / 2 weeks) over the course of 9 months
- Course management: LTER Network Office (LNO)
- Instruction: LNO staff, guest speakers, LTER Network-recruited mentors

## [Module Categories]{.dark-green} {.smaller}

![NCEAS logo](images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

\

All 15 proposed modules fall under one of two categories

\

::::{.columns}

:::{.column width="50%"}
### Team Science {{< fa people-group >}}

- Team Science Practices
- Inclusive Facilitation
- Supporting Divergent, Emergent, and Convergent Thinking
- Authorship & Intellectual Credit
- Project Management
- Logic Models
- Communicating Findings

:::
:::{.column width="50%"}
### Quantitative Skills {{< fa screwdriver-wrench >}}

- Reproducibility Best Practices
- Version Control
- Data Discovery & Management
- Data Visualization and Exploration
- Data Wrangling
- Analysis & Modeling
- Spatial Data & Interactivity
- Reproducible Reports

:::
::::
